data.title: Paula Flack on LinkedIn: Danny Saber is so cool. Go listen to the podcast and hear for yourself‚Ä¶
data.meta_description: Danny Saber is so cool. Go listen to the podcast and hear for yourself. His voice, his life, his work...such a cool guy.
data.text:
Been out of work since May, (despite my book being bang up to date with a campaign that was live during the 'Paris Olympics'), so in-between my job hunting commitments that I signed up for whilst on 'Universal Credit', I made a short film, (seems it's true that the devil will find work for idle hands). It's called 'Get Milk', and is about a suicidal dad who has failed to make a film, and is left with nothing but debt, and dead-ends. The budget was ¬£162.23p, (no, it was not made with benefit money). I really must be tripping because somehow, it's just received it's second selection for a film festival! üò≥ üêÑ ü•õ üìΩ üçø There's an ocean of goodwill behind this film, with the grace and favour of many who have gone above and beyond to help me get this over the line. I owe a debt of gratitude to each and every one of you, most especially to Paula Flack. Thank You. üíñ #peckhamandnunheadfilmfestival #cannesshortfilmfestival #malibufilmfestival #getmilk #shortfilm #pnfff #scottmarshall #ann√©kulonen #kristinaerdely #andythompson #paulaflack #keithbell #mikewallington #madeleinefarley #budgetfilm #fujifilm #R√òDE #urthfilters #manfrotto #neewer #kentfilmoffice #sussexfilmoffice #mentalhealth #sertraline #talkingtherapies

Australian musician Ben Lee's music career that started aged 14 Thurston Moore (Sonic Youth) heard his band and loved the music. Noise Addict were promptly signed to Ecstatic Peace, then moved to Grand Royal Records by Mike D of the Beastie Boys. For their second ever gig, Noise Addict went on as support for Sonic Youth then on tour with Sebadoh. By aged 16 he decided to go solo. Find out why he decided to go solo so soon after finding huge success with Noise Addict? What do Mike D and Money Mark have to do with Ben working with T-Bone Burnett and how did their song end up on the end credits of the film Best Men? How did Ben‚Äôs song ‚ÄúHow to Survive a Broken Heart" become integral to a scene in the Farrelly Brothers classic film There‚Äôs Something About Mary? And how happy was Ben to discover what music sync is and the exposure it brings? Ben‚Äôs music has been in many films and TV shows including Greys Anatomy, Scrubs and Deuce Bigalow; European Gigolo. He‚Äôs mentored on The Voice Australia and competed in The Masked Singer Australia; he‚Äôs recorded with Evan Dando and Mandy Moore, teamed up with Ben Folds and Ben Kweller to form The Bens and won ARIA Single Of The Year for his song Catch My Disease, but how did the idea for that song start (clue: it's not what you think!). His most recent album I‚Äôm Fun was released through Warner Music in June 2022 and to be honest, he is fun! Listen to this episode with Ben Lee and see for yourself. Listen now on Apple Music: https://lnkd.in/ePteRhwB or choose your favourite podcast provider: https://lnkd.in/eXtpUmM5 Plus there‚Äôs music from our audience with some of our favourite sync song submissions from 2022. Check out the quality of their music submissions. #podcasting #musician #musicpodcast #musicproduction #independentmusic #indiemusic #filmmusic #musicartist #songwriter #musicindustry #podcast #musicsync #synclicensing #musicsupervision

Today I‚Äôm sending love and a big congratulations to my dear friend, TSR producer and head of marketing, Paula Flack as she steps into her latest and well deserved position as Co Executive Producer of TSR. Paula has been in my life nearly 20 years, dating back to my days managing Donovan. She was our point person at EMI and always poured love and brilliance into every release. The past year + Paula has been by my side, 7 days a week helping me create our series, The Sync Report. She runs all our marketing, coordinates every featured guest conversation, organizing our Sunday Sync sessions and so much more. She has become one of my most cherished friends, advisor, motivator and beloved collaborator who continues to be a driving force in my life. I love you lady‚Ä¶ couldn‚Äôt have done any of this without you.

We‚Äôre back for SEASON 3!! Indie filmmakers will love our first episode with actor and director Brady Corbet, star of hit indie movies ‚ÄúThirteen‚Äù ‚ÄúSimon Killer‚Äù and ‚ÄúMysterious Skin‚Äù. Brady also starred as Alan Tracy in Thunderbirds and is best known for his role as Derek Huxley in hit TV show ‚Äú24‚Äù, alongside Kiefer Sutherland. Brady joined us to talk about his movie career; from child actor in TV and film to film directing. Hear what influenced Brady to pursue his love of the movies and how he was able to work with some of his filmmaking heroes including Lars Von Trier and Michael Haneke. Brady talks about how he left acting to become a filmmaker, how his own experiences of auditioning for roles as a child have influenced how he casts for his movies, why he often works with the same people and why he wishes he could make even smaller budget indie movies. Hear how he shot "Vox Lux" in 22 days and why he wanted Sia to write the music for the movie, starring Natalie Portman and Jude Law. Brady talks about the importance of music in his films and why he always has a musical concept in mind from the script stage, and so much more. This episode offers an incredible insight into the filmmaking process, including the effect of covid on Brady‚Äôs next film ‚ÄúThe Brutalist,‚Äù set for release later this year. Check out The Sync Report podcast now and go check out movies with and by Brady Corbet. Plus stay tuned for music from our Sunday Sync Session, including filmmaker Kevin Sharpley‚Äôs sync choice for his film ‚ÄúDeadly Night Out‚Äù, plus we listen to submissions for our own Holiday special TV Show. Out now on Apple podcasts: https://lnkd.in/eR9rDm-H Or choose your favourite podcast provider on Audioboom #podcast #indiefilmmaking #moviemakers #childactor #filmmusic #musicplacement #MusicLicensing #music #musicforfilm #musicsync #

In this week's episode we talk with multi-instumentalist, master producer, engineer and songwriter Professor Louie Hurwitz. He was engineer, producer and performer with The Band for 15 years, but want to know about his early career, how he came to be working with The Band, plus the many other bands he has worked with or that for the past 22 years he has led the Grammy nominated band Professor Louie & the Crowmatix? Plus guest host; musician and producer Dusty Wright talks to Louie about working with The Band for 15 years; co-producing and engineering three of their albums, plus their solo work. Then our second guest host, Sean Hurwitz gets into the technicalities and difficulties of recording back in the day, on analogue. Professor Louie and the Crowmatix have a new album out February 25, 2022, called ‚ÄúStrike Up the Band‚Äù so go check it out! Plus we feature music from these incredibly talented musicians ‚ÄúThe Better It Gets‚Äù by @mrphelpsmusic and @cinder_happy_ernst , featuring @aimeefrancismusic "Stranger" by @xiomamusic "XIV" by @the_piano_doctor Join Professor Louie on The Sync Report from Thursday 17th February on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Deezer, Podcast Addict or your favourite podcast provider. #podcast #musicians #musicproducer #musicengineer #musicproduction #newmusic #synclicensing #musicshow #musicsync #musicstudents #musicproduction #songwriting #filmmaking

We spoke to Music Publishing empresario Rob Bozas about growing up in South Africa during apartheid, becoming President of his radical anti-apartheid college radio station, meeting Steve Biko, working with Wet, Wet, Wet, Natalie Cole, Zimbabwean singer Alton Edwards, Robert Plant and many others, making himself irreplaceable in the studio, moving into music publishing, working with Peter Gabriel at Real World Publishing and working with music supervisors on major Hollywood movies including Gangs of New York, The Bourne Identity, Wall-E, Eddie The Eagle, Deadpool 2 and many others. (and that was a very long sentence!) This was a very interesting conversation. In addition, Indie Film Producer Ray Lee discusses his song choice for his movie trailer ‚ÄúZombie Infection‚Äù. Check it out now on Apple Podcasts: http://bitly.ws/o5KM Spotify: http://bitly.ws/o5KQ or wherever you usually listen to your podcasts. #podcast #musicians #musicproducer #synclicensing #musicsync #musicproduction #songwriting #musicschool #composing #applepodcasts #songwriter #filmmaking #antiapartheid #musicsupervisor #musicsupervision #musicpublishing #southafrica

Tune in to the latest podcast from The Sync Report, out today, with Award winning Film producer Byron A. Martin in conversation. We spoke to Byron about how to make it in filmmaking, the importance of gaining skills and experience, having the right attitude, networking, filmmaking before and since Covid 19, and so much more. Pick up filmmaking tips as Rose Ganguzza and Byron A. Martin delve deep in to the highs and lows of filmmaking, plus a guest appearance by award winning filmmaker Patricia Chica And then check out the music sync submissions from our listeners and supporters ... Under The City by Electron Love Theory See You Again (Ivy States Remix) by Nick Catoire & Ivy States Reckless by JJM (featuring Nomae ) You Are by Mohsin zaman We Found A Way by On Wednesday & Vecelina Minkovski aka Vessy Mink And if that's not enough, there is a brand new **PAID music sync opportunity** announcement during this podcast episode. Check it out for full details of this fantastic opportunity to work with a Hollywood music producer AND have your music sync'd in an Indie film. Available now on Apple Podcasts: http://bitly.ws/nF2p Spotify: http://bitly.ws/nF2t ..or wherever you normally listen to your podcasts. #musicsync #musicplacement #indiefilmmaker #filmmaker #filmmakersworld #filmmusic #filmmusiccomposer #musicproducer #musicopportunity #makemusic #musicstudents #musicproduction #applepodcasts #newpodcast #outnow #thursdayvibes #timetoshine

We're getting in early to wish you all a Happy New Year. We've made a short but sweet episode for your enjoyment. Thank you all for your support and we look forward to bringing you so much more in 2022. Special thanks to Jess aka Nomae Music for the song "Christmas Won‚Äôt Be Christmas Time" and to Willow (aged 3) for.... well take a listen to hear how hard she worked. Happy New Year is here: http://bitly.ws/mPdG or on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or wherever you usually enjoy your podcasts. #happynewyear2022 #newpodcast #applepodcasts #goodbye2021hello2022 #whatayear #thankyou #thankyouforyoursupport #music #filmmaking

Craig Ross joined us for Thursday's recording of The Sync Report podcast. American guitarist Craig Ross is well known for being Lenny Kravitz guitarist, having toured and written with Kravitz since the 1991 "Mama Said" tour, but do you know who introduced them? Craig was playing guitar in Hollywood venues when he was 16 with his band Broken Homes, opening for musicians including Stevie Ray Vaughan, INXS, Guns N' Roses and Jane's Addiction, but do you know who and what originally inspired Craig to pick up a guitar? You can find out the answers to all of this and more, including a guest appearance by Craig's old High School pal Danny Saber of Black Grape (who is our guest next week). Plus hear what happens as Craig meets Generation-X and Westworld guitarist Bob "Derwood" Andrews for the very first time on The Sync Report. All this and more, including the ongoing sync opportunity for The Sync Report show. Available now on Apple podcasts here: http://bitly.ws/jWDz Spotify or wherever you normally listen to your podcasts. Don't miss it! And please, rate and review the show when you've finished. #musicians #podcast #opportunity #songwriter #guitarists #hollywood #musicsync #applepodcasts
